column1: recommendationid;steamid;num_games_owned;num_reviews;playtime_forever;playtime_last_two_weeks;last_played;language;voted_up;votes_up;votes_funny;weighted_vote_score;comment_count;steam_purchase;received_for_free;review_date;month_review;character_count;syllable_count;lexicon_count;sentence_count;difficult_words_count;flesch_reading_ease;dale_chall_readability_score;polarity;subjectivity;review;clean_reviews;3gram_reviews;3grams_nouns_verbs_adj

142246538;76561197992200829;0;41;1013;1013;16/07/2023 12:29:15;english;False;2;0;0.4981235861778259;0;True;False;17/07/2023 06:40:50;2023-07;938;235;194;6;19;72.53;8.66;-0.04388020833333334;0.5319444444444446;"The TLDR is this is a on sale game at best.... Gameplay is decent but ""story"" seemed to be something the devs felt were optional. Its like they wanted to make a DQ version of World of Final Fantasy and did a DQ spin on it and made is awful.

Beat the game in 18hrs which after that to get the ""true""? ending you need to find 50 iconic treasures as the ""story"" Sorry yah the story was WEAK asf now you want me to do some RNG based crap to get the last piece of this 2 page long story for this game? Hard pass.
PROS:
Gameplay is decently fun and easy to get into
Soundtrack is good (for a DQ so the bar is low)
Graphics if your into the art style you will love it
CONS:
No real story
Can feel repetitive at times
Not challenging at all
Game is short as hell (Took me 18 hrs and im sure I could of shaved off a few hours with little difficulty)
Overall it would be okay at 20 bucks I guess for a bored weekend but not much more than that

column1: 142131799;76561197966830152;1793;71;534;534;16/07/2023 20:04:37;english;True;9;0;0.5702382326126099;1;False;True;15/07/2023 15:58:03;2023-07;193;49;36;4;6;79.26;10.66;-0.0625;0.4166666666666667;A little bit of the Dragon Quest Monsters formula mixed with an ARPG. Unshackled from the Switch at 60fps. Definitely going to take my time with this one. P.S. Type PEK into the Gift Code menu.;['little'
column2: 'bit'
column3: 'dragon'

column1: This is a weird one. It's not a massive new mainline DQ game
column2: but this game scratches a particular itch.

column1: If I had to say what it's like
column2: this game feels a lot like Dragon Quest's version of Pokemon Legends Arceus
column3: with a dash of Xenoblade-style landscapes and some hints of collectathon-ish platforming. You travel around
column5: scouring every nook and cranny for new treasures. You take on various sidequests that sort of are just very loose broad guidelines that you'll fulfill as you continue to explore the world. The game is quite hands off and really does let you proceed at your own pace. The world is the real star here
column6: with lots of evocative landscapes and biomes
column8: pretty considered and interesting level design that at times can make use of the traversal abilities you bring alongside monsters you recruit. It's very colorful
column10: very cozy. Like an introduction to the idea of a JRPG and open world game rolled into one with a Dragon Quest skin.

column1: Combat is...fine. It's okay
column2: but this was developed by Tose
column3: who have made some really good action RPGs before. This is very simple in comparison. It's not the end of the world
column4: and it lends the game a kind of laid back charm
column5: but it feels like some potential was missed both in your main character combat and monster setup. Was also expecting there to be more puzzle solving where you swap off between the characters
column6: but while there are sort of traversal puzzle environments and the like that I've seen so far
column7: sibling puzzle solving seems to not be a thing.

column1: Music is good! It's mostly all old midi Dragon Quest stuff
column2: but it's a much better showing than XI
column3: for instance. It's also fun to just go around to encampments and the like and talk to NPCs because the game very much has that Dragon Quest localization flavor to it.

column1: Story is cute so far. It's not amazing by conventional standards
column2: but it has that sort of DQ vignette fairytale feeling through and through. Wish there was more voice acting
column3: but the major scenes are fully voiced.

column1: Also weird shoutout to the UI. It's extremely extremely clean
column2: and gives perhaps
column3: Kirby/Smash/Kid Icarus vibes? Very friendly-looking. Nice change of pace from the mainline titles which are kinda very window-heavy.

column1: As a PC version
column2: this is very solid. No real UE4 stutters
column3: runs extremely well. Some scenes are capped at 60 or 30 fps it seems like but the bulk of gameplay can be uncapped. It seems like if you're not hitting the framerate targer you set in settings though you can get some slowdown
column4: so just make sure to pick an fps limit that you're able to hit. I can pretty comfortably do 120
column5: and it looks night and day compared to the Switch. Better draw distance
column7: and the like. Nothing like DLSS
column8: but honestly the TAA here is decent enough and the game runs good enough already. Decent sampling of graphics and display settings
column9: but no arbitrary aspect ratio unfortunately.

column1: For Steam Deck
column2: in my experience you can get 30 fps for ~4 hours of battery with a 7-8w TDP cap
column3: or you can get 2-3 hours of battery at 60 fps with uncapped TDP (capped to 12 or so also seems to work
column4: but some drops here). Intermediate framerates like 40

column1: Price wise
column2: maybe wait for a slightly larger discount
column3: $30 or $35 or so. But I paid $40 and don't feel particularly ripped off

column2: It's not the best Dragon Quest RPG...but It's Dragon Quest!

column1: It's charming
column2: refreshing...perfect for holidays!

column1: Collect monsters
column2: search for treasures
column3: do some dailies...complete the main quest here and here...

column1: Forget the 20 FPS on Switch
column2: the game run great on PC ^^

column1: So...Enjoy!";['yes'
column2: 'best'
column3: 'dragon'

column2: the monster collection is done quite nicely as well as some of the treasure hunting ideas are fun like the vision puzzle
column3: though it is sometimes way to easy to find the treasure even without the use of the vision puzzle.

column1: Combat is simple enough but with the few mechanics there it keeps you actively involved
column2: though there is a small change I would like to change is an introduction of classes and perhaps some shape changing of the dagger into other weapon types.

column1: Also a big drawback is the very limited customization you have available
column2: as so far I could only choose the name of the gang and medals that is the equivalent of gear so they don't have show them visually. I understand this choice is probably due tot he limited power of the Switch.

column1: So yes this is a Switch port
column2: but don't take this the wrong way they did minimal work for it to be a decent port with uncapped FPS and graphical settings as well as full mouse and keyboard support. Though you don't get a mouse pointer to navigate through the UI
column3: this is done by the movement keys and mouse buttons. The camera is however controlled by mouse movement.";['fun'

column2: so I may be bias here but... I really liked this game. It's simple
column3: fun
column4: very colorful and has that unique charisma of the franchise.

column1: PS: bring more Dragon Quest games to Steam ASAP!";['big'
column2: 'dragon'
column3: 'quest'

column1: 142108560;76561198334822561;143;22;1970;1970;17/07/2023 09:19:02;english;True;11;1;0.6203396320343018;0;True;False;15/07/2023 07:22:25;2023-07;787;188;142;7;24;76.25;8.76;0.03893939393939394;0.5142424242424242;"Bought this day 1 on the Switch and finished it. Great game with lots of fanservice but it unfortunately looked like garbage on the Switch. This fixes that problem entirely with its new graphics options. Game runs buttery smooth and looks fantastic on my low-mid tier pc so if you didn't get / didn't like the Switch version
column2: definitely get this.

column1: Everything from the Switch version still exists such as the gift codes for the King Slime and Killing Machine and the online aspect stays as well. I am currently unsure if there is anything new but I will update this if I find anything. Here's hoping that they decide to drop the new DQ Monsters on Steam and other platforms as well day 1 instead of exclusivizing it to the Switch and shadow dropping it here later like they did with this.";['bought'
column2: 'day'
column3: 'one'
